translation.en: Tommy?
SAM: Are you okay? Oh, my God. Guys.

translation.en: I had this crazy dream. I'm so glad to see you.

translation.en: You know, can't believe I'm saying this, but I'm glad to see you too, Tommy.

translation.en: Kids falling from the sky. My work here is done.
translation.ja: 空から子供が戻ったし 任務完了だな

translation.en: I'm a writer too.
Well, an aspiring, very stuck writer at the moment.

translation.en: My condolences.
All the horrors in the world can't compare to the terrors of the blank page.

translation.en: Um, any advice on college essays?

translation.en: Well, first rule of writing: write what you know.

translation.en: Thirty years, and I couldn't figure out how this book should end. And somehow you figured out how to finish it in one night.
translation.ja: 30年も書けなかった結末を 君は一晩で終わらせた

translation.en: I believe in you.
Hm. Write what you know.
SARAH: Recount a time in your life when you faced a fear, challenge or failure.
translation.ja: 恐怖や難題 失敗に直面した時･･･

translation.en: I think most of us are afraid that we don't have a story to tell.
translation.ja: 人は自分について 語ることがないのが怖い

translation.en: That there's nothing special about us.
translation.ja: 特別なものが何もないと

translation.en: And then a moment comes when you least expect it
translation.ja: でも まるで予期せぬ時に

translation.en: where you have to step up, no matter how terrified you are.
translation.ja: いかに怖くても 立ち向かう時が来る

translation.en: But what I've learned is that it's good to be scared sometimes.
translation.ja: それに 時には恐怖も必要

translation.en: Scared of losing the people we love.
Stop, stop! It's a ventriloquist dummy.

translation.en: Oh. Really?
That's not funny, Mom. Too soon.

translation.en: No, I like it.
Congratulations, Sonny.
translation.ja: 〝ニコラ･テスラ科学展 〞 〝ニコラ･テスラ科学展 〞 おめでとう ソニー 〝ニコラ･テスラ科学展 〞

translation.en: Thank you so much, Principal Harrison.
translation.ja: 〝ニコラ･テスラ科学展 〞 ありがとうございます 〝ニコラ･テスラ科学展 〞

translation.en: SARAH: Or scared of not achieving our dreams.
translation.ja: 〝ニコラ･テスラ科学展 〞 夢がかなわない恐怖

translation.en: Because those moments remind us just how special our stories really are.

translation.en: Here's to us. Indeed.
Hey, Sarah! Hi, Mr. Chu.

translation.en: CHU: Watch this.
I like it.
Yeah, I just made it life- size this year.
You know, just in case.
No, seriously, you know, just in case.
Right. I'll see you later, Mr. Chu.

translation.en: Bye!
SARAH: And maybe when you face enough of your fears
life stops being so scary after all.

translation.en: Hey, honey.
What happened?
I got in.
I knew it. I knew you could do it.

translation.en: Oh, I'm so proud of you!
I guess I'm proud.
Thanks, Sonny. Come on, bring it in.

translation.en: Congratulations.
Here, take off your jacket.
Guys, give her some ornaments, please. Oh, yeah, yeah, yeah.
I'm so happy! Ha- ha- ha!
Finally, a new book.
Yes.

Slappy! I thought the book got you.

translation.en: Maybe those others, but not me.

translation.en: Why is that?
You know I always survive. You wrote me that way.

translation.en: In fact, I wrote my own story while I was gone.

translation.en: And guess what.
You're the main character.
No.
No!
You try living in a book for a while, Papa.
